title: How to Make Andhra Prawn Fry

steps.headline: Prepare the prawns.
steps.description: Marinate them in the ginger-green chili paste, 3/4 tsp chili powder, lemon juice, turmeric powder, and salt. Let it rest for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Add 1/4 cup water and bring them to a boil.
steps.description: Reduce the heat and let it cook for about 8 minutes. Turn the heat off and drain all excess water.

steps.headline: Sauté the garlic, onions, curry leaves, and kasuri methi.
steps.description: Add oil to a pan and start with the garlic. Sauté for about 30 seconds. Add in the curry leaves, kasuri methi, and onions. Sauté them until they turn light brown with a caramelized texture. This should take about 7-8 minutes.

steps.headline: Combine the remaining ingredients.
steps.description: Add the prawns, saunf, 1/4 tsp chili powder, garam masala, and coriander powder. Stir fry for 3 minutes. Add the grated coconut. Sauté for 3 more minutes.

steps.headline: Add salt if needed and turn the heat off.
Serve hot.
steps.description: You can also stir fry the dish with rice.

text: Prepare the prawns. Marinate them in the ginger-green chili paste, 3/4 tsp chili powder, lemon juice, turmeric powder, and salt. Let it rest for 10 minutes. Add 1/4 cup water and bring them to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it cook for about 8 minutes. Turn the heat off and drain all excess water. Sauté the garlic, onions, curry leaves, and kasuri methi. Add oil to a pan and start with the garlic. Sauté for about 30 seconds. Add in the curry leaves, kasuri methi, and onions. Sauté them until they turn light brown with a caramelized texture. This should take about 7-8 minutes. Combine the remaining ingredients. Add the prawns, saunf, 1/4 tsp chili powder, garam masala, and coriander powder. Stir fry for 3 minutes. Add the grated coconut. Sauté for 3 more minutes. Add salt if needed and turn the heat off.  Serve hot. You can also stir fry the dish with rice.
